hobby.message: Analog photography still treating you right?
Urban exploration or just avoiding work?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Yeah. Just took the long way getting here.
Stopped by the old depot, nothing major.
Some of us still fly drones out there.
Checkpoint made it slower than usual.
Made it. Got stopped at that new checkpoint near the yard.
I fly drones, usually over the freight depot area.
Not as easy with patrols now.
Last time, signal kept cutting. Probably Directorate interference.
Had to pack up early.
Yeah, I did. Was flying drones before this, my weekly unwind.
FPV, freestyle—through old industrial zones. Best place, usually.
Security lines rerouted everything. My usual spot's half-blocked now.
Last run, lost video for a minute—jamming or just glitches?
Feels different flying when patrols are sweeping below.
Still worth it for the headspace.
Made it. Took the long route from my usual drone spot, depot roof.
FPV drone flying is my thing—freestyle, weaving power lines and rusted cranes.
Directorate's set up scanners everywhere. Some evenings, I don't even try.
Last week, a patrol nearly spotted my quad in the floodlights.
Flying used to clear my head. Now it's more like a risk calculation.
If they jam my signal, it costs me more than just a drone.
Still, every pass through the stacks—worth it, mostly.
Yeah. Barely. Patrolled three times just getting in from the drone zone.
I've flown FPV freestyle since before they shut half the city down.
Whenever BCI curfews come in, routes get weird—more guards, random badge scans.
Tech interference is worse. Last flight, I lost my signal for forty seconds. Heart stopped.
Used to weave ten stacks in one line. Now it's like hide and seek.
Once, I ditched a drone in a vent to avoid patrols scanning frequencies.
Flying's therapy. Honestly helped after my brother vanished—gives me control.
Not sure how much longer I'll be able to keep it up if this holds.
hobby_answer: Yeah. Still dodging towers.
Harder now, since Directorate patrols started sweeping the yards.
Curfews make it risky to fly at all.
Interference messed with my feed last time.
Guess you need clearance for hobbies now.
Dodging, but keeping out of sight.
Directorate checkpoints block half the good spots lately.
Signals get jammed since the curfew patrols started.
I lost one drone to interference—some new noise on the bands.
Everyone acts nervous. Quiet is safer out there now.
Not really a hobby city anymore.
Yeah, still flying when I can.
Freight depot's basically off-limits with all these new checkpoints.
Last run, Directorate scanners stalled my route—score's too low for quick-pass lanes.
Signal lag worse since patrols showed up. Jamming or sabotage, maybe.
Feels like someone's tracking you for just having gear.
Hard to clear your head when the BCI pings every move.
Gonna stay grounded for a bit.
Still flying, but it's different now.
Used to be simple—just find empty industry, fly till sunrise.
Latest Directorate sweep locked down my best entry points. Had to reroute twice last week.
Lost good video—signal drop, or maybe someone blocking bands.
Had to stash a drone after patrol lights swung up.
BCI curfews mean every detour gets flagged—a '42' doesn't help.
Guess the system thinks drones look suspicious now.
Nobody relaxes anymore. Even hobbies feel risky.
Still at it, can't really quit drones—even if Stenograd tries to make me.
I used to pull all-nighters at the depot, flying loops to clear my head.
Now you're tripping scanners just hauling your gear, especially if your BCI is south of fifty.
Last Thursday, a Directorate patrol caught a glimpse—signal scrambled right after, probably on purpose.
Had to ditch the drone in a runoff pipe.
Whole crew I flew with mostly stopped. Too much tracking, too many patrols.
They say sabotage groups are jamming for cover—maybe that's cover for someone else.
Odd thing, all this started after Halden's death and the labor glitches.
Maybe when the system breaks down, even fun has consequences.
